title: Colonial Dance Bands 1950-1952 (SWP) [FLAC] {MKOP}
description:
Colonial Dance Bands~Kenya, Tanganyika, Portuguese East Africa, Northern Rhodesia, Belgian Congo 1950 & 1952 (SWP) [FLAC] {MKOP}

This album presents a variety of African bands playing dance music during the colonial period. Recorded in the British colonies of Kenya, Tanganyika and Northern Rhodesia, Portugese East Africa, and Belgian Congo. Some bands were professional outfits playing to Europeans, mostly in hotels, others were enthusiastic amateurs copying styles they heard on the radio and playing to mostly African audiences. One is immediately struck by the element of nostalgia, but more than anything we have very good musicians playing very interesting music, creating their own sounds and styles within the limits of self-censorship ('not too wild please!). Each and every one was a pioneer in their way, and deserve tremendous respect for that alone. 

01. Shabani Abdullah & The Dar-Es-Salaam Jazz Band - Nani Aliemtia Bure
02. Shabani Abdullah & The Dar-Es-Salaam Jazz Band - Nimepata Mpenzi Mtoto
03. Ally K. Dykes & The Dar-Es-Salaam Swingers - Chaupele Mpenzi
04. Egyptian Musical Club - Baadina
05. East Coast Orchestra - Doa Jeupe
06. East Coast Orchestra - Wapenzi Kuwaona
07. Jauharah Orchestra - Maashuki
08. Jauharah Orchestra - Mimi
09. Jauharah Orchestra - Damu Imenikauka
10. Jauharah Orchestra - Wanguukutina
11. Rhythm Experts Band - Mapenzi Ya Kwetu Sisi
12. Coast Social Orchestra - Nali Kisafiri
13. Coast Social Orchestra - Sini Kere Kere Omama
14. Coast Social Orchestra - Ngamririkanya
15. Lake Victoria Band - Gild A Heri
16. Grupo Manjacaziana - Miseria Da Vida
17. Grupo Manjacaziana - Meu Amor Era Aviador

19. Grupo Manjacaziana - Cachopa
20. Chippy's Dance Band - Love Is A Merry-Go-Round
21. Chippy's Dance Band - Ndinokuziwa
22. Chippy's Dance Band - Chemutengure
23. Orchestre Opera - Elisa Mwasi Kitoko
24. Henri Bembele & Orchestre Tinapa - Beni
